alert.note: Alert for Meade; Seward (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 10:44AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Seward and Meade Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1043 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Meade State Park, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Seward and Meade Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
